qas.question: What was so important to English mystics?

answers.text: the journey of, or process of, faith

qas.question: The process of faith leads one to what?
What did the English Dominican mystics not require in their work?
What did the English Order of Dominicans believe was the only thing they needed?

plausible_answers.text: the journey of, or process of, faith

qas.question: What was not important to English mystics?
What does the process of faith not led one to?

plausible_answers.text: to pursue mystical life without the visions and voices that are usually associated with such a relationship with God

qas.question: What was not possible for English Dominican mystics?

plausible_answers.text: a mystical process that allowed them, in the end, to experience what they had already gained knowledge of through their faith only.

qas.question: What did English Dominican mystics not experience?
What the one thing that the English Order of Dominican believe they did not need?

context: For English Dominican mystics, the mystical experience was not expressed just in one moment of the full knowledge of God, but in <a0_0><b4_0>the journey of, or process of, <b8_0>faith<b8_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>. This then led to an understanding that was directed toward an experiential <a1_0><b5_0>knowledge of divinity<b5_0/><a1_0/>. It is important to understand, however, that for these mystics it was possible <b6_0>to pursue mystical life without the <a2_0>visions and voices<a2_0/> that are usually associated with such a relationship with God<b6_0/>. They experienced <b7_0>a mystical process that allowed them, in the end, to experience what they had already gained knowledge of through their <a3_0>faith<a3_0/> only.
